article_node.title: For a Reporter, Writing About Bear Attacks in Romania Was a Homecoming of Sorts
article_node.summary: Romania is home to the largest population of brown bears in Europe, but rising bear attacks due to human encroachment and a hunting moratorium have disrupted the balance between humans and bears. Since 2016, bear-related incidents have resulted in 20 fatalities. Rukmini Callimachi, a reporter with Romanian roots, highlights this complex relationship in her recent story for The New York Times.
